Body: I suspect one could make the claim that most languages either lack counters (or measure words) or that they've become (mostly) extinct. An example in English would be cattle. One does not say "I have 3 cattle", instead one says "I have 3 head of cattle". The book I suspect you are thinking of is Women, Fire and Dangerous Things. In it, in Chapter 6, there is also a short discussion of a single Japanese counter, hon (which is used to count long thing things such as sticks, pencils, rivers, phone calls, ball game hits & pitches and dried snakes) and how these categorize how these are in some respects metaphors for how one thinks about the world.
